page.title: 06CUSTOMS AND TRADITIONS(ii)
page.content: Following a hearing the previous year,the Commons Comissioner gave a decision in Feb.1985 that Chagford Parish Council should hold rights on behalf of all parishioners over certain "open fields" for three months of the year. The decision was not welcomed by the fields' owners, though they accept that some unspecified rights may be involved.The Parish Council is trying to resolve the position which is currently sub judice. {Swaling}_controlled burning of bracken _is a local custom to increase grass growth and kill parasites such as ticks.It must be over before 31 March. {Other new events}which may become annual include a Stallion show at Collihole,Pony Club Camp at Buda and a Gymkhana at Waye Barton.
